alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jasper; Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 9:23AM EDT until July 23 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT/1230 PM EDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate one to two inches of rain have fallen, with additional heavy rainfall possible due to slow moving storms. This will likely cause minor flooding. * WHERE...Portions of east central Illinois and northwest Indiana, including the following counties, in east central Illinois, Iroquois. In northwest Indiana, Benton, Jasper and Newton. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM CDT /1230 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 822 AM CDT /922 AM EDT/, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Watseka, Fowler, Kentland, Milford, Otterbein, Remington, Oxford, Sheldon, Goodland, Cissna Park, Boswell, Earl Park, Stockland, Woodland, Wellington, Ambia, Dunnington, Raub, Wadena and Swanington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
